articles.title: Section 41(1) Addition Not Automatic on Creditor’s Write-Off

It held that such write-off requires factual verification and cannot, by itself, trigger addition under section 41(1). The consulting firm advocates for broadening the Phased Manufacturing Program and enhancing the Market Access Initiative to strengthen export promotion.

Industry data shows Iran remains the second largest buyer of Indian basmati rice, with exports of $470 million so far this year. Exporters report falling domestic prices and over ₹2,000 crore in delayed payments due to disruptions inside Iran.

भाषिनी समुदाय: भारत की भाषा एआई पारिस्थितिकी को मज़बूत बनाना
श्री धर्मेंद्र प्रधान ने आज नई दिल्ली में राष्ट्रीय प्रौद्योगिकी, विज्ञान शिक्षा एवं अनुसंधान संस्थान परिषद (एनआईटीएसईआर) की 13वीं बैठक की अध्यक्षता की
झारखंड के रांची में भाई-बहन के लापता होने के मामले में एनसीपीसीआर ने स्वतः संज्ञान लिया
भारत में प्रशिक्षण इकोसिस्टम के विकास के लिए एकीकृत ढाँचे पर गठित कार्य समिति ने रिपोर्ट प्रस्तुत की
पीएफआरडीए ने नाबालिगों की दीर्घकालिक वित्तीय सुरक्षा मजबूत करने के लिए एनपीएस वात्सल्य योजना 2025 के दिशा-निर्देश जारी किए

सीसीआई ने क्रिसकैपिटल फंड एक्स, टू इन्फिनिटी पार्टनर्स और ब्लू वेव इन्वेस्टमेंट्स लिमिटेड द्वारा सामूहिक रूप से नैश इंडस्ट्रीज (आई) प्राइवेट लिमिटेड में कुछ इक्विटी शेयर पूंजी के अधिग्रहण को मंजूरी दे दी है
उपराष्ट्रपति की मकर संक्रांति, पोंगल, लोहड़ी, माघ बिहू, कनुमा, उत्तरायण, टुसू परब और फसलों के अन्य त्योहारों के अवसर पर देशवासियों को शुभकामनाएं

articles.summary: The Financial Times reported earlier in the day that ‌the company was ‌seeking to cut what it pays suppliers for goods sold on ‌its e-commerce platform, as it moves to reverse concessions intended to soften the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs.

articles.title: Venezuelans regain access to social network X after yearlong block
articles.summary: The social network X was once again accessible in Venezuela on Tuesday, more than a year after users were blocked by deposed president Nicolas Maduro, who was captured by US forces last week. Rodriguez assumed power after Maduro was captured by US military forces on January 3 along with his wife, during attacks that left more than 100 dead, according to official figures.

articles.title: US gives green light to Nvidia H200 chip exports to China
articles.summary: According to the regulations, the chips will be reviewed by a third-party testing lab ‌to confirm their technical AI capabilities before they can be shipped to China, which cannot receive more than 50% of the total amount of chips sold to American customers.

articles.title: MeitY seeks higher budgetary allocation for its ECMS scheme
articles.summary: Meity is seeking a higher budget for its electronic component manufacturing scheme (ECMS) as industry demand exceeds expectations. The six-year scheme, with staggered funding, aims to boost production, attract investments, and generate over 1.4 lakh direct jobs. So far, 46 projects have been approved, creating tens of thousands of employment opportunities.

articles.title: Hackathons turn talent cliquebait
articles.summary: Hackathons are evolving beyond casual coding events into major platforms for recruitment, marketing, and innovation. Companies are increasingly using them to engage talent, generate ideas, and test new technologies at scale. ​​T​​hey are turning from game days to recruitment fairs, marketing events and even hunting grounds for pre-seed ventures.

articles.title: The dark side of dark stores
articles.summary: The army of on-the-clock delivery boys, imperilling themselves and pedestrians, has become a familiar sight across urban India. They emerge, bearing essentials you ordered, from the hub that enables the ten-minute delivery—the dark store. Some 5,000 dark stores have mushroomed across India’s cities in the last few years, with wide-ranging implications on traffic, safety and much else. Who is responsible for their oversight?

articles.title: Meta layoffs 2026: CTO Andrew Bosworth confirms job cuts for roughly 10% of employees within the Reality Labs unit
articles.summary: Meta Platforms is beginning to cut more than 1,000 jobs from the company’s Reality Labs division, part of a plan to redirect resources from virtual reality and metaverse products toward AI wearables and phone features. The cuts are expected to hit roughly 10% of employees within the Reality Labs group, which has about 15,000 workers.

articles.title: Meta mulls doubling output of Ray-Ban glasses by year end: Report
articles.summary: Meta and EssilorLuxottica are considering doubling the production capacity ‍of their artificial intelligence-powered ​smart glasses to 20 million units annually by ⁠the end of this year, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday. Meanwhile, Meta is also cutting more than 1,000 jobs from the company's Reality Labs division.

articles.title: China limits Nvidia chip purchases to special circumstances: Report
articles.summary: The Chinese government this week told some ‍tech companies it ​would only approve their purchases of Nvidia's ⁠H200 AI chips under special circumstances, such as for university research, the Information reported on Tuesday, citing two people with ‌direct knowledge ‌of the situation.

articles.title: Britain seeks 'reset' in copyright battle between AI and creators
articles.summary: British technology minister Liz Kendall said on Tuesday the ‍government was seeking a "reset" on ​plans to overhaul copyright rules to accommodate artificial intelligence, ⁠pledging to protect creators while unlocking AI's economic potential.

articles.title: Musk vs OpenAI trial set for April 27: US court
articles.summary: The US court has scheduled the trial between Elon Musk and OpenAI for April 27.

articles.title: Eternal says no material change to Blinkit business as quick commerce firm drops 10-minute delivery branding
articles.summary: Responding to a notice by the exchanges following the government asking platforms to discontinue 10-minute delivery branding, Eternal said in a filing that there was no change to its quick commerce business model that could have any material impact on the company.

articles.title: Polygon targets stablecoin payments with deals worth $250 million
articles.summary: Blockchain firm Polygon Labs said on Tuesday it would ‍buy crypto payments company ​Coinme and crypto infrastructure provider Sequence for ⁠more than $250 million, as it looks to tap the growing demand for stablecoin-based transactions.

articles.title: Fintech firm PayU Payments' loss narrows to Rs 248 crore in FY25
articles.summary: Fintech firm PayU Payments has reported a narrowing of loss to Rs 248 crore in the financial year 2024-25, according to a regulatory document shared by market intelligence firm Tofler on Tuesday.

articles.title: Britain takes to TikTok to highlight immigration raids
articles.summary: Britain's government has launched a TikTok account showing raids on migrants ‍accused of working illegally, with the ​aim of convincing voters and potential new arrivals that it is tackling ⁠what many see as Britain's most pressing problem: immigration.

articles.title: X down for thousands of users globally, Downdetector shows
articles.summary: There ‌were ‌more than 22,900 reports of ‌issues with the platform in the US as of 9:19 am ET, according to Downdetector, ​which tracks ​outages by collating status ‌reports from ‍a number of ‍sources.

articles.title: PFRDA pushing pension adoption among private employees, says chairman
articles.summary: The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) aims to expand pension coverage to private sector employees, beyond its traditional government base, said its chairman S Ramann. It is focusing on improving distribution and offering flexible products to suit different incomes. PB Fintech founder Yashish Dahiya said that the company plans to invest in its pension business.

articles.title: Microsoft president pushes Big Tech to 'pay our way' for AI data centres amid rising opposition
articles.summary: As Big Tech expands into AI, it encounters significant pushback from communities worried about the impacts on local power grids and water supplies. Microsoft's top executive, Brad Smith, is calling on government officials to push for infrastructure investment from tech companies instead of passing the costs onto taxpayers.

articles.title: Social media harms teens, watchdog warns, as France weighs ban
articles.summary: Social media harms the mental health of adolescents, particularly girls, France's health watchdog said Tuesday as the country debates banning children under 15 from accessing the immensely popular platforms. France is currently debating two bills, one backed by President Emmanuel Macron, that would ban social media for under 15s.

articles.title: 'Are you dead?': Chinese app for solo dwellers goes viral
articles.summary: A new app, 'Are You Dead?', is topping sales charts in China. It alerts emergency contacts if users do not check in every 48 hours. This safety tool is designed for China's growing population of people living alone.

articles.title: Uber invests in CarDekho-backed fleet management startup Carrum
articles.summary: Uber has made a strategic investment in Gurugram-based fleet operator Carrum, though financial details were not disclosed. The startup will use the funding to expand its clean mobility fleet and enter more cities. Carrum, backed by CarDekho Group, currently operates over 3,000 CNG vehicles and partners closely with Uber across major urban markets.

articles.title: Govt asks quick commerce platforms to drop '10-minute delivery' branding
articles.summary: The labour minister has asked quick commerce firms to stop advertising 10-minute deliveries, citing worker safety. Platforms have agreed to drop the branding, though operations will continue largely unchanged. The move follows gig-worker strikes and wider concerns that ultra-fast promises create pressure, despite the sector’s rapid growth in Indian cities nationwide.

articles.title: Google to develop, manufacture smartphones in Vietnam, Nikkei Asia says
articles.summary: Google ‍will begin ‍new product introductions (NPI) for its ‌Pixel, Pixel Pro and Pixel Fold phones in Vietnam, with ‍development of the lower-end ‍Pixel A ⁠series ⁠remaining in China for now.

articles.title: Blinkit removes '10-minute delivery' claim on govt's orders; Swiggy, Zepto may follow suit
articles.summary: Blinkit has removed its '10-minute' delivery promise across all platforms following intervention by the Union Ministry of Labour. This move comes after a nationwide gig worker strike on New Year's Eve 2025, which highlighted concerns over delivery personnel's health, safety, and income.

articles.title: Google parent joins elite $4-trillion market cap club
articles.summary: The company's shares rose as much as 1.7% to $334.04 after news broke that Apple and Google had entered a multi-year deal for Gemini models to power the next generation of the former’s virtual assistant, Siri. The announcement cemented Alphabet as Wall Street's second-most valuable company, surpassing Apple for the first time since 2019.

articles.title: Elon Musk calls AI tie‑up with Apple ‘unreasonable concentration of power for Google’
articles.summary: Apple has chosen Google’s Gemini models and cloud infrastructure to power its future foundation models Under this partnership, Gemini will power Apple Intelligence features, including a more personalised Siri, expected to launch this year as part of iOS 26.4, likely in March or April.

articles.title: Trump says Microsoft to make changes to curb data center power costs for Americans
articles.summary: "I never want Americans to pay ‌higher Electricity bills because of Data Centers. Therefore, my Administration is working with major American Technology ‍Companies to secure their commitment to ‍the American ⁠People, ⁠and we will have much to announce in the coming weeks," Trump said on social media.

articles.title: Brazil's antitrust body opens investigation into WhatsApp business tool
articles.summary: In ‌a statement, CADE said that there are potential anti-competitive practices arising from ‍the new terms regarding ‍the access ⁠and ⁠offering by artificial intelligence tool providers of their technologies to WhatsApp users.

articles.title: SK Hynix to invest nearly $13 billion in chip packaging plant in South Korea
articles.summary: SK Hynix said ​accelerating global competition in AI is driving ‌a ‍sharp rise in demand for ‍AI-focused memory, underscoring the need to respond ‌proactively to growing demand for high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chips.

articles.title: Pentagon is embracing Musk's Grok AI chatbot as it draws global outcry
articles.summary: The announcement comes just days after Grok - which is embedded into X, the social media network owned by Musk - drew global outcry and scrutiny for generating highly sexualized deepfake images of people without their consent.

articles.title: Nvidia says no upfront payment needed for its H200 chips
articles.summary: The company said it "would never require customers ‌to pay ‌for products they do not receive", in a response ‌to a Reuters story on January 8 about the company having imposed unusually stringent terms requiring full upfront payment from Chinese customers seeking ​its artificial intelligence chips.

articles.title: ISRO's rocket encounters anomaly; loses 16 satellites in first mission of 2026
articles.summary: This is the second consecutive setback for the PSLV in eight months. Earlier, in May this year, PSLV-C61 failed to place the EOS-09 earth observation satellite into orbit due to a third-stage anomaly. Meanwhile, startups and industry experts have repeatedly flagged delays in launch schedules and limited access to testing facilities, prompting some firms to explore overseas launch options.

articles.title: India much higher than US from growth perspective, says top Bosch executive
articles.summary: For German manufacturing giant Bosch, India is emerging as a key development base for its artificial intelligence-related technology innovations in smart mobility and industrial manufacturing. The company, which earlier this year committed to investing $2.9 billion in AI-related innovations, is looking at India as a key software hub for all its global business developments. The country houses more than 20,000 of Bosch’s 38,000 software developers.

articles.title: Tier-II GCCs grapple with longer senior hiring cycles
articles.summary: Global Capability Centres (GCCs) are shifting senior technology roles back to metro hubs from Tier-II cities and adopting hybrid hiring models to cope with a severe talent crunch. Smaller cities are currently taking more than 75 days to fill leadership positions, compared with 42-56 days in the metros, staffing firms told ET.

articles.title: Meta to build gigawatt-scale computing capacity under Meta Compute effort
articles.summary: ​Meta will ⁠establish Meta ‌Compute ‌to ‌construct tens of gigawatts of ​computing ​infrastructure ‌this ‍decade ‍and hundreds of gigawatts ‌more in the ‍future, CEO ‍Mark ⁠Zuckerberg ⁠said on Monday.

articles.title: UK to accelerate law criminalising creation of sexual deepfakes
articles.summary: ​Britain will bring into effect ⁠a law criminalising the creation of non-consensual intimate images this week, ‌technology ‌minister Liz Kendall told parliament on Monday ‌after regulator Ofcom launched an investigation into Elon Musk's X.

articles.title: Meta to exclude Italy from rival chatbot ban on WhatsApp
articles.summary: Meta Platforms will exclude Italy from its ‍ban on rival AI chatbots ​on WhatsApp following an order from the country's antitrust authority, ⁠according to a notice sent to AI providers and developers.

articles.title: Italy antitrust cuts Amazon record fine to $878 million
articles.summary: Italy's ​antitrust authority said ⁠on Monday it had reduced ‌a ‌record fine imposed ‌on US ecommerce giant Amazon to 752.4 million ​euros ($878.20 million) from ​an original ‌amount ‍of 1.128 ‍billion euros.

articles.title: Alphabet hits $4 trillion valuation as AI refocus lifts sentiment
articles.summary: Alphabet hit a $4 trillion market valuation on Monday, as the Google parent's ‍sharpened artificial intelligence focus allayed ​doubts about its strategy and thrust it back to ⁠the forefront of the high-stakes race.

articles.title: Nvidia, Eli Lilly to spend $1 billion over five years on joint research lab
articles.summary: Nvidia and US pharma giant ‍Eli Lilly will spend $1 ​billion building a new joint research lab in ⁠the San Francisco Bay area over five years which will use Nvidia's newest generation Vera Rubin AI chips, the firms said on Monday.

articles.title: Ola Electric enters residential energy storage with Shakti rollout, diversifies beyond EVs
articles.summary: Shakti, announced earlier by founder Bhavish Aggarwal, is powered by Ola Electric’s indigenously developed 4680 Bharat Cell and is positioned as a residential and small commercial energy storage solution.

articles.title: Meta appoints former Trump adviser Dina Powell as president and vice chair
articles.summary: Dina Powell McCormick, who has worked with both US President Donald Trump and former President George W Bush, is expected to join Meta’s management team, where she will work closely with its compute and infrastructure teams to oversee large-scale, multi-billion-dollar investments in data centres, energy systems, and global connectivity.

articles.title: Shadowfax to launch IPO next week at Rs 7,400-crore valuation: Sources
articles.summary: Shadowfax, a Flipkart-backed logistics firm, is set to launch its IPO next week at a lower-than-expected valuation of around Rs 7,400 crore. The company aims to raise Rs 1,900 crore, partly to expand its network and partly for brand-building. Shadowfax has posted strong revenue and profit growth in recent years.

articles.title: Govt refutes Reuters report on demanding source code from Apple, Samsung
articles.summary: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has said that a Reuters report which claims the union government has demanded that smartphone makers share their source code is false. The report also stated that firms like Apple and Samsung have to implement software changes due to the government’s security concerns.

articles.title: Budget 2026: The missing tax framework for India’s outbound M&A wave
articles.summary: Budget 2026 Expectations: Indian corporates are increasingly pursuing outbound investments for market expansion and technology acquisition. However, the current tax and regulatory framework lags behind, necessitating reforms to support global ambitions. Key areas for improvement include clearer tax deductions on interest, tax neutrality for overseas mergers, and expanded DTAA networks.

articles.title: India’s wholesale inflation ticks up to 8-month high of 0.83% in Dec after contracting 0.32% in Nov
articles.summary: India’s wholesale price inflation rose to 0.83% in December from a 0.32% contraction in November, exceeding market expectations of 0.30%, government data showed. Retail inflation also edged up to a three-month high of about 1.3% in December as food deflation eased, though it remained below the RBI’s 4% target for the fourth straight month.

articles.title: Will Trump be the uninvited guest at Sitharaman’s Budget table?
articles.summary: Budget 2026 will reflect Donald Trump's undeniable imprint, shaping India's export assumptions and economic priorities amidst a challenging global trade environment. Facing punitive US tariffs and potential sanctions, India's focus shifts to domestic competitiveness and resilience to navigate geopolitical trade pressures and achieve export growth.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Urban infra fund may get additional ₹10,000 cr injection
articles.summary: The government plans to enhance urban infrastructure in the upcoming budget. An additional ₹10,000 crore may be allocated to the Urban Infrastructure Development Fund. This initiative aims to improve urban living quality and address financing gaps. The fund supports various urban development projects, particularly in midsize cities.

articles.title: Cooling prices, uneven relief: Inflation at 12-year low, but gaps widen across states and rural India
articles.summary: India's retail inflation hit a 12-year low of 2.2% in 2025, with food prices entering deflation. Despite the national easing, 17 states and union territories experienced inflation above the average, and rural areas saw higher pressure than urban centers. Goa recorded the most significant rural-urban inflation disparity.

articles.title: RBI's likely to hold interest rates with inflation set to rise
articles.summary: Economists anticipate the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will introduce more money into the financial system. With inflation expected to rise, interest rates are likely to stay the same in upcoming policy meetings. This means attention will shift to how much money the RBI will add and when it will do so.

articles.title: Iran unrest delays India's ₹2,000 cr basmati rice export dues; exporters eye new markets
articles.summary: Indian basmati rice exports are facing a significant setback as payments worth approximately ₹2,000 crore are stuck as protests in Iran have halted trade. Iran, a major buyer, is unable to remit payments or honor contracts. This disruption is causing uncertainty for exporters, impacting basmati rice prices in India's wholesale markets.

articles.title: Spice exporters may face heat from China chillies
articles.summary: China is now growing and exporting cumin and chillies, key Indian spice exports. This development poses a challenge to India's global leadership in spices. Chinese spices are often cheaper, even after local processing. This shift's impact will become visible in the coming seasons. Farmers are planting less due to crop losses and low export prices.

articles.title: Economic growth strongest, most sustainable form of financial inclusion: CEA
articles.summary: Economic growth is the most sustainable form of financial inclusion, Chief Economic Adviser V Anantha Nageswaran stated. He emphasized that when economies generate jobs and demand, people naturally enter the financial system. True inclusion enables individuals to move from survival to economic independence, not just account activation.

articles.title: US tariff on Iran partners to have minimal impact on India: Govt sources
articles.summary: India's trade with Iran is minimal, representing a small fraction of its total commerce. Recent US tariff announcements targeting countries doing business with Iran are not expected to significantly affect India's economic engagement. Indian exporters remain watchful but composed. Trade with Iran is projected to decline further due to external economic factors.

articles.title: World Bank raises FY26 India growth estimate to 7.2%
articles.summary: The World Bank has upgraded India's FY26 growth forecast to 7.2%, driven by robust domestic demand and rising rural incomes. While FY27 growth is projected to moderate to 6.5% due to US tariffs, it's expected to rebound to 6.6% in FY28. South Asia's growth is anticipated to rise to 7.1% in 2025, largely due to India's strong economic performance.

articles.title: Trump to attend WEF Davos meet; strong India delegation expected
articles.summary: US President Donald Trump will lead a large delegation to the World Economic Forum in Davos, alongside leaders from G-7 nations, China, and Pakistan. The five-day meeting, beginning January 18, will focus on Ukraine, Gaza, and Latin America, with a strong Indian presence including four Union ministers and six chief ministers.

articles.title: RBI proposes resumption of licensing of urban co-op banks
articles.summary: The Reserve Bank of India is considering reissuing licenses for Urban Cooperative Banks after a two-decade pause. A discussion paper has been released, inviting feedback on resuming licensing and eligibility criteria. A key proposal includes a minimum capital requirement of Rs 300 crore for new UCBs. This move aims to strengthen the cooperative banking sector.

articles.title: India's December vegetable oil imports rise 8 pc: SEA data
articles.summary: India's vegetable oil imports saw an eight percent jump in December 2025. This rise was driven by higher shipments of soyabean and sunflower oils. Despite this monthly increase, total imports for the first two months of the oil year are down. Palm oil imports declined, while crude palm oil and sunflower oil saw significant gains.

articles.title: Central govt capex likely to slow in rest of FY26 as spending front-loaded in first half: Morgan Stanley
articles.summary: The central government's capital expenditure (capex) is expected to slow in the remaining part of FY26 as a large part of the spending was front-loaded in the first half of the fiscal year, highlighted a report by Morgan Stanley.

articles.title: India dismisses claims of suspending trade with Afghanistan
articles.summary: India has refuted claims circulating on Pakistani social media. These reports falsely suggested a suspension of trade with Afghanistan. The government stated that a fabricated letter is being shared by propaganda accounts. India's trade figures with Afghanistan for 2024-25 show significant export and import values.

articles.title: India’s growth trajectory setting the stage for Budget 2026
articles.summary: Union Budget: India's economy is experiencing strong momentum ahead of Budget 2026, driven by robust consumption, favorable monsoons, and government spending. Reforms like GST 2.0 and export liberalization, alongside R D incentives, are poised to further stimulate growth and position India as a global hub for high-value services.

articles.title: India-EU FTA: Importance, benefit for India's foreign trade & other key specifics | An explainer
articles.summary: India-EU FTA: Tariffs or import duties are either reduced or eliminated under an FTA. Therefore, an FTA will open markets, align regulations between the two, and benefit key industries like technology, pharmaceuticals, automobiles, and textiles.

articles.title: India's growth resilient despite global challenges: HSBC Mutual Fund
articles.summary: India's economic growth shows resilience amidst global challenges, with domestic factors like declining crude prices and a normal monsoon expected to boost momentum. Despite global uncertainties, a constructive outlook for India's investment cycle is anticipated, driven by government infrastructure spending and a pickup in private investments, particularly in renewable energy.

articles.title: Budget 2026: India needs to breathe new life into its struggling farm backbone
articles.summary: Budget 2026: To pave the way for Viksit Bharat, a transformative surge in India's agricultural sector is crucial. The forthcoming budget should prioritize substantial funding for farming initiatives and innovative research. Implementing strategic reforms can significantly boost farmer productivity and incomes. Additionally, fostering growth in agri-allied businesses, processing, and exports will stimulate rural economies and bridge economic gaps.

articles.title: Iran unrest hits Indian basmati rice exports, industry body says
articles.summary: Iran's upheaval is having a ripple effect on India's basmati rice trade, leading to delayed payments and uncertainty for exporters. As a result, domestic prices of basmati have plummeted. To navigate these turbulent waters, the Indian Rice Exporters Federation is advocating for cautious measures and exploring diversification strategies.

articles.title: View: India has 7.4% growth, but where are the taxes?
articles.summary: Budget: Should the govt play to the gallery of domestic equity investors by lunging for growth? Or should it choose fiscal restraint to keep a lid on rising borrowing costs — both for itself and the private sector? There are no easy answers.

articles.title: MAGA deal in making: US resumes trade talks with ‘real friend’ India
articles.summary: US Ambassador designate Sergio Gor announced that trade pact discussions with India will resume Tuesday, aiming to resolve differences beyond tariffs. He emphasised the strong personal relationship between Trump and Modi, highlighting the partnership's significance beyond trade, encompassing security, technology, and energy cooperation.

articles.title: US tariff pressures push British Columbia to boost India trade
articles.summary: Canadian province's premier David Eby, who is leading a trade mission to India from January 12-17, told ET in an interview that the province is trying to develop more opportunities with India to diversify trade, which has been hit by the US tariffs.

articles.title: Net direct tax mopup rises 8.8% till January 11
articles.summary: Despite a slower pace of tax refunds, the growth in collection was much below the budgeted 12.7% increase for the entire 2025-26. With less than three months left in this fiscal, experts are cautiously optimistic about meeting the budget target of ₹25.20 lakh crore.

articles.title: Retail inflation hits 3-month high of 1.3% in December
articles.summary: In December 2025, retail inflation climbed to 1.3%, rising from November's 0.7%, setting a new three-month peak. While this increase remains shy of the central bank's goal, the easing of food deflation contrasted with the uptick in prices for various goods.

articles.title: Centre earmarks Rs 5,925 crore for coal, lignite exploration from FY27
articles.summary: The investment will be channeled through the Central Sector Scheme (CSS) of coal and lignite exploration.

articles.title: Germany's Merz in India: Amid American squeeze, Europe steps in
articles.summary: India is strategically reorienting its partnerships towards the European Union as U.S. trade faces increasing tariffs. Germany's Chancellor's visit highlights this shift, with a potential EU free trade agreement and growing defense cooperation signaling a comprehensive, structural realignment in India's foreign economic policy.

articles.title: Wheat sowing up 2 pc to 334.17 lakh hectares till Jan 9 of current rabi season: Govt
articles.summary: Wheat sowing has increased by 2 percent to 334.17 lakh hectares as of January 9. This rise in acreage for the rabi season is attributed to better monsoon rains and higher minimum support prices. Other rabi crops like paddy, pulses, Shri Anna, coarse cereals, and oilseeds have also seen increased sowing areas. Overall rabi crop coverage has reached 644.

articles.title: Net direct tax collection grows 8.82% to Rs 18.38 lakh crore till January 11
articles.summary: India's net direct tax collections have seen a significant increase of 8.82%, reaching Rs 18.38 lakh crore between April 1 and January 11. This growth encompasses both corporate and non-corporate tax contributions. Notably, total refunds issued during this period saw a substantial decrease of 16.92% compared to the previous year.

articles.title: Rapid digitalisation of banks reshaping financial risks, requires supervisors to fundamentally rethink: RBI DG
articles.summary: Speaking at the Third Annual Global Conference of the College of Supervisors in Mumbai, RBI Deputy Governor Swaminathan J said that traditional indicators such as capital adequacy and liquidity are no longer sufficient to assess the health of banks in a technology-driven environment.

articles.title: BMI forecasts 7% growth for India in FY27
articles.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth. BMI forecasts 7.4 per cent expansion for the current fiscal year and 7 per cent for FY27. Favourable policies and recent reforms are expected to boost investment and consumption. This positive outlook is supported by strong GDP estimates and rising exports. The foundation for continued economic progress is firmly in place.

articles.title: India’s retail inflation quickens for second straight month to 1.33% in December
articles.summary: India's retail inflation rose to 1.33% in December 2025, driven by increased costs in personal care, vegetables, meat, fish, eggs, spices, and pulses. Despite this uptick, inflation remained below the RBI's 4% target for the eleventh consecutive month. Food prices saw a reduced decline, with vegetable deflation easing.

articles.title: Growing inequality is the top economic concern for youth worldwide: WEF survey
articles.summary: A new World Economic Forum survey reveals that global youth identify growing inequality as their top economic concern. Many are also eager to enter politics rather than just critique, with over a third considering running for office. Climate change remains a defining global worry, even amidst personal financial anxieties.

articles.title: Donald Trump tries to break the Fed. What the clash means for India
articles.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell revealed the Justice Department served subpoenas threatening criminal indictment over his Senate testimony, which he calls a "pretext" to pressure the Fed on interest rates. President Trump denied knowledge but criticized Powell, escalating a conflict over central bank independence and monetary policy.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Trump tariffs or not, trade power should stay with India
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: A 1985 Plaza Accord saw global powers coordinate to devalue the dollar, impacting Japan severely. Today, similar economic conditions and Donald Trump's protectionist policies are reshaping global trade. India, historically less integrated, may find an unexpected advantage in this shift towards self-sufficiency, potentially mitigating direct trade shocks.

articles.title: Miners, energy stocks hold Australian benchmark at 2-month closing high
articles.summary: Indian shares reached a two-month peak on Wednesday. Heavyweight miners and energy stocks saw gains due to rising commodity prices. However, a sharp fall in major banks limited the overall advance. Top miners BHP and Rio Tinto advanced. Gold miners also closed at a peak. Energy stocks climbed significantly. In New Zealand, the benchmark S P/NZX 50 index ended higher.

articles.title: Sebi clears Kissht, Alcobrew Distilleries and 4 other companies for IPO. Check full list
articles.summary: Sebi has approved six companies, including Kissht, Alcobrew Distilleries and Indo MIM, to raise funds via IPOs over the next year. The offerings include fresh issues and promoter sales, with proceeds aimed at expansion, acquisitions, debt repayment, and corporate purposes. Key IPO dates, price bands, and lot sizes are yet to be announced.

articles.title: Tata Elxsi Q3 PAT slumps 45% YoY; brokerages flag 22% downside risk — here’s what they say
articles.summary: Tata Elxsi's net profit plunged 45.3% due to a one-time labour law charge. While revenue and margins showed some strength, brokerages remain divided. Some see potential in auto and healthcare recovery, while others cite rich valuations and muted visibility in key segments, leading to cautious or sell ratings.

articles.title: 2026 will be the year of geopolitics, not AI; Emerging markets still resilient: Geoff Dennis
articles.summary: Geopolitics, not AI, may dominate markets in 2026, says emerging markets expert Geoff Dennis. Despite global tensions, emerging markets are outperforming even as oil prices rise and the dollar strengthens. Dennis expects only limited Fed rate cuts, warns of geopolitical flashpoints, and explains why EMs could remain the “flavour of the year.”

articles.title: Fed probe rekindles diversification debate as investors weigh ‘Sell USA’ risks
articles.summary: A U.S. Justice Department probe into Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is sparking renewed investor interest in diversifying portfolios away from America. While markets remain calm, concerns about the Fed's independence are growing, potentially leading to gradual shifts in global capital allocation. This development adds to existing worries about U.S. fiscal health and debt.

articles.title: Budget 2026 to double down on defence? Motilal Oswal flags capex winners, yield risks ahead of FY27
articles.summary: Motilal Oswal expects Budget 2026 to reinforce defence-led capital expenditure while maintaining fiscal discipline. With limited tax relief, reliance on RBI dividends and elevated borrowing, the brokerage flags capex-linked sectors as equity winners and warns of range-bound bond yields in FY27.

articles.title: Will Budget revive capex stocks? What defence, rail and infra investors should watch
articles.summary: The Union Budget on February 1 is shaping up as a litmus test for the capex trade, which has slowed over the past year. With fiscal discipline likely to be maintained, any additional spending is expected to be selective, focusing on sectors such as defence, railways, and infrastructure-linked segments, rather than a broad-based capital expenditure push.

articles.title: US inflation firms up in December, keeping Fed in wait-and-watch mode
articles.summary: U.S. consumer inflation edged up 0.3% in December, keeping year-on-year CPI at 2.7%, reinforcing expectations that the Federal Reserve will maintain a wait-and-watch approach. While price pressures remain above target, the data suggests a gradual disinflationary trend, providing markets with reassurance without prompting an immediate shift in monetary policy.

articles.title: Indian bonds extend fall as index snub continues to bite
articles.summary: Indian government bonds declined for a second consecutive day. This follows a surprise decision to exclude Indian debt from a global index. Investors are cautious. Oil prices are also rising due to Middle East developments. The Reserve Bank of India is expected to support bond prices. Other investors have increased their bond purchases.

articles.title: Polycab shares slip 3% after likely Rs 590 cr block deal, domestic mutual fund reportedly sells stake
articles.summary: Polycab India shares fell nearly 3% after a Rs 590 crore block deal involving 7.98 lakh shares, with reports suggesting a domestic mutual fund sold its stake. The stock has shown mixed performance across recent timeframes.

articles.title: Nomura initiates coverage on ITC Hotels, IHCL with Buy rating. Check target price, upside potential
articles.summary: Nomura has initiated coverage on ITC Hotels and Indian Hotels Company with a Buy rating, citing strong demand trends and asset-light expansion. The brokerage expects healthy growth in revenue, margins and cash flows over the medium term, supported by favourable demand–supply dynamics and improving return ratios.

articles.title: Gold financiers ride bullion rally, but valuations flash caution: Ambareesh Baliga
articles.summary: Gold financiers have seen strong gains but investors should manage risk. IT sector earnings may offer short-term surprises, but sustained growth is uncertain. Larsen Toubro presents a long-term buying opportunity on dips. Footwear stocks are not recommended at this time. Market sentiment remains cautious with a focus on valuations.

articles.title: Chennai Petroleum stock flashes bullish reversal signal, Kkunal V. Parar see upside ahead
Vedanta shares jump 6% to record high after Nuvama raises target price to Rs 806
articles.summary: Vedanta shares surged to a record high of Rs 678.50 after Nuvama Institutional Equities raised its target price to Rs 806, citing value unlocking from the demerger. The brokerage anticipates strong EBITDA growth driven by sustained commodity prices and cost optimization, maintaining Vedanta as a top pick.

articles.title: Motilal Oswal initiates coverage on Canara HSBC Life, sets Rs 180 target; lists 5 growth drivers
articles.summary: Motilal Oswal has initiated coverage on Canara HSBC Life with a Buy rating and Rs 180 target, citing industry underpenetration, strong bancassurance partnerships, channel diversification and improving VNB margins as key drivers of medium-term earnings growth.

articles.title: NSE unlisted shares in high demand on listing buzz. Should investors buy now or wait for IPO?
articles.summary: NSE shares are in high demand in the unlisted market following renewed IPO buzz and Sebi’s regulatory signal. While early unlisted investments offer exposure, pricing is opaque and liquidity limited. Waiting for the IPO provides clearer valuation and regulated pricing. Long-term prospects remain strong amid India’s growing capital markets.

articles.title: Selective buying opportunities emerge as earnings catch up with prices: Aniruddha Naha
articles.summary: Investors see chances for long-term gains as market corrections meet better earnings. Aniruddha Naha from PGIM India Asset Management suggests building portfolios over the next six months. Sectors like autos, commodities, and PSU banks show promise. Discretionary consumption may rise with pay commission revisions. Quick commerce valuations face a reality check.

articles.title: Unusual Solidarity: Global central banks step in to back Jerome Powell
articles.summary: Global central bankers have united to defend the U.S. Federal Reserve's independence amid political pressure and a federal probe into its headquarters' renovation. Leaders from Europe, North America, and Asia publicly backed Fed Chair Jerome Powell, highlighting the critical role of central bank autonomy for global financial stability. This rare show of solidarity underscores widespread concern over potential interference.

articles.title: Rupee recovers 11 paise to 90.12 against US dollar in early trade
articles.summary: The rupee strengthened by 11 paise to trade at 90.12 against the US dollar, buoyed by lower crude oil prices and a retreating American currency. Domestic equity markets also showed resilience, with the Sensex and Nifty registering modest gains amid cautious trading. Traders are closely watching geopolitical developments and awaiting US inflation data for Federal Reserve policy cues.

articles.title: FII holding in Eternal declines for 7th straight quarter. Is recent correction a buying opportunity?
articles.summary: Foreign institutional investor holding in Eternal has declined for seven consecutive quarters, falling from 54% to 36.2% due to a 49.5% foreign ownership cap aimed at maintaining Indian ownership status for Blinkit's inventory-led model.

articles.title: Copper hits new peak as supply concerns outweigh dollar strength
articles.summary: Copper and tin prices surged to record highs on Wednesday, driven by persistent supply worries and a speculative buying spree amidst escalating geopolitical tensions. Despite a stronger dollar, copper's rally was fueled by mine disruptions and anticipated U.S. tariffs. Tin also saw significant gains, with other base metals also trading higher.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO: Why a small PSU drew Rs 1.1 lakh crore bids and what investors should expect from listing?
articles.summary: Bharat Coking Coal's IPO attracted massive investor interest, securing bids worth Rs 1.1 lakh crore for its Rs 1071 crore offering. This overwhelming response was fueled by the company's dominant position in coking coal production and attractive valuations. Investors are anticipating a strong listing performance. The company's focus on expanding beneficiation capacity also signals future growth prospects.

articles.title: Anand Rathi Wealth nears Rs 1 lakh crore AUM as inflows and markets drive growth, says CEO Rakesh Rawal
articles.summary: Anand Rathi Wealth has been inchin closer to ₹1 lakh crore AUM as strong client inflows are matching market gains. CEO Rakesh Rawal explains all about growth drivers, margin discipline, ROE sustainability and also why it's guidance has remained unchanged despite hitting targets early, even as market volatility keeps caution high.

articles.title: Oil India among 5 F&O stocks with a sharp rise in futures open interest
articles.summary: Several NSE F O stocks, including Oil India, witnessed a sharp rise in futures open interest on January 13, signalling increased trader participation and fresh position-building. The trend points to heightened activity across select stocks in the derivatives segment.

articles.title: Tata Elxsi shares shed 3% after Q3 profit declines 45% YoY
articles.summary: Tata Elxsi shares fell over 3% after the company reported a sharp 45.3% year-on-year drop in Q3 net profit, hit by a one-time exceptional charge linked to changes in India’s labour laws. Revenue grew marginally, while adjusted profit declined 5.4%, reflecting continued pressure on margins despite steady demand in software services.

articles.title: Silver soars to all-time high of Rs 2.81 lakh/kg, spot breaks $90/oz for first time
articles.summary: Silver prices surged to a fresh lifetime high on MCX, outperforming gold as softer US inflation data boosted rate-cut expectations. Strong global cues, geopolitical tensions and technical momentum kept precious metals in focus, with analysts flagging further volatility and key support levels.

articles.title: RailTel shares in focus on cancellation of 3 work orders totalling over Rs 609 cr
articles.summary: RailTel shares will be in focus after the PSU cancelled three Bihar government education infrastructure work orders worth over Rs 609 crore, citing unavoidable reasons. The cancellations halt project execution and add pressure to a stock already under recent selling pressure.

articles.title: Rs 1.4 lakh crore shock! Why Reliance shares are hit in New Year selloff & what Q3 results could change
articles.summary: Reliance Industries has seen a significant market cap drop in early 2026 due to concerns over Russian crude exposure and slowing retail growth. Despite near-term headwinds, brokerages view 2026 as a "year of catalysts," anticipating strong energy segment performance and potential upside from Jio's listing and tariff hikes.

articles.title: Just Dial shares in focus as Q3 profit slips 10% YoY on one-time exceptional expense
articles.summary: Just Dial reported a 10.2% year-on-year decline in net profit for Q3FY26, reaching Rs 118 crore. This was attributed to a higher tax rate and a one-time exceptional expense. Despite the profit dip, operating revenue grew 6.4% to Rs 305.7 crore, with a robust EBITDA margin of 31.2%.

articles.title: TCS shares in focus on last day to qualify for Rs 57/share dividend. Check record, payment date
articles.summary: Tata Consultancy Services shares will remain in focus as January 14 marks the effective cut-off date for eligibility for its third interim and special dividend. The IT major has announced a combined payout of Rs 57 per share, alongside reporting a year-on-year decline in December-quarter net profit.

articles.title: Indian Overseas Bank shares jump 3% after 5 bps cut in overnight MCLR
articles.summary: Indian Overseas Bank's share price saw an uptick after the lender cut its overnight MCLR by 5 bps to 7.95%, effective January 15, following an ALCO review. The revision, made amid an ongoing government stake sale, is expected to have a limited impact on existing borrowers, with other MCLR tenors unchanged.

articles.title: HCL Technologies sees strong deal momentum as AI-led demand drives $3 billion bookings
articles.summary: HCL Technologies reports strong deal momentum with $3 billion quarterly bookings as AI-led discretionary spending drives growth. Advanced AI revenues rise 20% sequentially to a $600 million run rate, while margins remain stable despite wage hikes and one-time costs. Management expects AI services and large deals to support growth momentum ahead.

articles.title: Expect a long pause on policy rates as supply pressures dominate bond markets: Puneet Pal
articles.summary: India's fixed-income markets face prolonged policy rate pauses and range-bound but volatile bond yields. Supply pressures and liquidity tightness are expected to persist, influencing market dynamics more than near-term policy actions. Investors are advised to favor selective duration strategies and defined investment horizons.

articles.title: Manappuram Finance among 4 stocks flash bullish signals, indicating possible uptrend
articles.summary: On January 13, four Nifty500 stocks appeared on the bullish White Marubozu scanner, signalling strong intraday buying interest. This candlestick pattern reflects firm buyer dominance throughout the session, indicating improving momentum and raising the probability of a near-term uptrend in select stocks.

articles.title: Eternal among 4 stocks showing bullish RSI upswing
articles.summary: On January 13, four NSE large-cap stocks featured in the RSI Trending Up scan after their RSI crossed above the 50 mark from lower levels. This technical development signals improving price momentum and strengthening buying interest, often tracked by traders to spot potential upside and emerging bullish trends.

articles.title: Hindustan Zinc shares jump 2% as silver hits record high, up 26% in 2026. Here’s what experts are saying
articles.summary: On Wednesday, January 14, shares of Hindustan Zinc soared as silver prices hit all-time highs. As a prominent player in silver production, the company stands to gain immensely from this surge. Financial analysts recommend that investors consider a buy-on-dips approach amid this bullish trend.

articles.title: Amagi Media Labs IPO Day 2: GMP indicates 6% listing gain; Check subscription status — Should you subscribe?
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs IPO saw a mild uptick in grey market premium to nearly 6% on its second day, following a lukewarm response on Day 1 with only 6% subscription. The company operates in the connected TV and programmatic advertising space, with funds aimed at expansion and technology enhancement.

articles.title: Titan Company Share Price Live Updates: Titan Company Receives Fresh Recommendation with Positive Outlook
Adani Ent Share Price Live Updates: Adani Enterprises Maintains Positive Trajectory
Tata Motors PV Share Price Live Updates: Tata Motors PV's stock price rises slightly
IndusInd Bank Share Price Live Updates: IndusInd Bank's Price Breakout Signals Strength
Inside India’s ten-minute reckoning; TCS & HCTtech CEOs on Q3 and beyond
articles.summary: Happy Wednesday! India’s fast-growing quick commerce industry was forced to slam the brakes on its “10-minute” delivery claim. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

articles.title: Wint Wealth secures Rs 250 crore in series B funding
articles.summary: Investment platform Wint Wealth has secured Rs 250 crore (about $27 million) from investors led by Vertex Ventures SEA India to support its expansion plans. Ajinkya Kulkarni, cofounder of the Bengaluru-based startup, said Eight Roads Ventures, 3one4 Capital, Arkham Ventures, and Zerodha’s investing arm Rainmatter also participated in this round.

articles.title: Wellness brand Pee Safe closes a $32 million funding round with OrbiMed
articles.summary: Pee Safe has closed a $32 million round with OrbiMed, a global healthcare-focused private equity firm. The company plans to deploy the capital to scale its offline retail presence, strengthen marketing efforts, and deepen its reach across quick commerce platforms and marketplaces.

articles.title: Regulatory delays, late-stage funding gaps slowing India’s deeptech startups: VCs
articles.summary: Speaking at a panel discussion hosted by Ankur Capital’s Deep Science Forum on Tuesday in Bengaluru, investors said while the government schemes and funding are present, accessing them is “painful,” with grants sometimes arriving nearly two years after application. They added that while India can leapfrog into advanced manufacturing and semiconductors, the capital-intensive, long-gestation nature of these sectors demands patient funding.

articles.title: Data centre biz has room for multiple biggies: TCS CEO K Krithivasan
articles.summary: Tata Consultancy Services is in talks with multiple AI firms to set up data centres in India and is pursuing acquisitions to build AI capabilities. CEO K Krithivasan said AI-driven projects are growing despite some short-term revenue cannibalisation, while CFO Samir Seksaria confirmed net headcount fell 11,151 in Q3, with hiring continuing. TCS has restructured salaries to comply with new Labour Codes without reducing take-home pay.

articles.title: HCLTech is counting on new growth areas like AI-led software, hardware: CEO C Vijayakumar
articles.summary: As the $283-billion IT service industry navigates a shift in its delivery mechanisms and revenue streams, HCLTech is focusing on new areas to bring in revenue instead of waiting for macroeconomic conditions to get better or traditional spend to continue, its chief executive C Vijayakumar said in an interview with ET.

articles.title: AI to move from pilots to production, see wider adoption in 2026: Neysa CEO
articles.summary: Neysa, a Mumbai-based AI and cloud infrastructure startup, sees enterprises moving from AI experiments to full-scale adoption. CEO Sharad Sanghi expects artificial general intelligence by 2027 as model reliability improves. Citing a recent MIT study which found that 95% of agentic AI deployments are yet to move to production, Sanghi said that that will change over the next 12 months, marking a major shift in enterprise adoption this year.

articles.title: Microsoft says will foot AI's massive power bill
articles.summary: Microsoft said Tuesday it will shoulder the full electricity costs of its US data centers to prevent American households from facing higher power bills driven by surging AI energy demand. "I never want Americans to pay higher Electricity bills because of Data Centers," Trump wrote.

articles.title: How AI 'deepfakes' became Elon Musk's latest scandal
articles.summary: Elon Musk's company xAI has faced global backlash in recent days over sexualised "deepfake" images of women and children created by its Grok chatbot. Indonesia on Saturday became the first country to block access to Grok entirely, with neighbouring Malaysia following on Sunday. India said Sunday that X had removed thousands of posts and hundreds of user accounts in response to its complaints.

articles.title: Israel says $450 million invested in local VCs to support tech innovation
articles.summary: Around $450 million in public and private money has ‍been invested in nearly ​a dozen Israeli venture capital funds under a programme ⁠aimed at sustaining technology investment during a slowdown in VC markets, a government body said on Tuesday

articles.title: Onebrief raises $200 million at a valuation of $2 billion
articles.summary: A military startup Onebrief has secured a funding of $200 million. This investment values the company at over $2 billion. Onebrief has also acquired Battle Road Digital, a company specialising in defense gaming and simulation technology.

articles.title: Misochain Tech raises Rs 18 crore in funding led by Capital A
articles.summary: Aerospace deeptech company Misochain Technologies has raised Rs 18 crore in a funding round led by Capital-A, a venture fund for manufacturing and deeptech, a release said.

articles.title: Illumina launches dataset to speed up AI-powered drug discovery
articles.summary: Illumina has introduced a new dataset to speed up drug discovery using artificial intelligence. This initiative involves major drugmakers like AstraZeneca, Merck, and Eli Lilly. The dataset will train advanced AI models to understand diseases better. This development aligns with efforts to reduce animal testing. Companies are increasingly using AI for faster and cheaper drug development.

articles.title: Seattle Consulate hosts event on India's expanding AI ecosystem ahead of Delhi Summit
articles.summary: The Consulate General of India in Seattle co-hosted a special event providing an overview of the country's expanding AI ecosystem and its evolution, ahead of the global AI summit to be hosted in New Delhi next month.

articles.title: AI education dialogue calls for urgent rethink of learning systems in AI era
articles.summary: Held at Jio Institute, Navi Mumbai, the half-day roundtable brought together more than 50 leaders from philanthropy, edtech firms, academia and the private sector as an official pre-summit event of the India AI Impact Summit 2026, the organisers said in a press release.

articles.title: Sarvam AI and Tamil Nadu govt to establish sovereign AI park
articles.summary: Tamil Nadu has partnered with Sarvam AI to establish a Rs 10,000 crore Sovereign AI Park, aiming to create 1,000 deep-tech jobs. This initiative will build an independent AI ecosystem within the state, fostering local talent and ensuring data sovereignty.

articles.title: Spain moves to curb AI deepfakes, tighten consent rules on images
articles.summary: Spain's government has approved a new bill to combat AI deepfakes. The legislation will strengthen child protection and set 16 as the minimum age for image consent. It also limits the unauthorised use of AI-generated images and voices for commercial purposes. European Union nations are also moving to criminalise non-consensual sexual deepfakes by 2027.

articles.title: Voice AI startup Deepgram raises $130 million at $1.3 billion valuation
articles.summary: Voice AI startup Deepgram has secured $130 million in funding, valuing the company at $1.3 billion. This investment will fuel international expansion into Europe and Asia-Pacific. Deepgram also plans to develop new AI models and pursue strategic acquisitions.

articles.title: End of Q-Comm's 10-min era; Google meets Siri
articles.summary: Blinkit drops “10-minute delivery” claim after labour ministry intervention. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Quantum software company Haiqu raises $11 million
articles.summary: Haiqu, a quantum software startup, has secured $11 million in funding. The company aims to make quantum computing more accessible by reducing costs and improving hardware performance for larger applications.

articles.title: Malaysia to take legal action against X, xAI over Grok concerns
articles.summary: The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission (MCMC) already suspended access to Grok, which is integrated into both the X and xAI platforms, on Sunday. It has now appointed solicitors to commence "legal proceedings" against X and xAI, the regulatory body said, without specifying what form the proceedings would take.

articles.title: Liquidnitro Games raises $19 million from Northpoint Capital, Nexus
articles.summary: The fresh capital will be used to scale the Hyderabad-based company’s AI-enabled game production and live services platform, expand its global operating footprint, and back co-investments with publishing partners, cofounder Sandeep Kowdley told ET in an interaction.

articles.title: PSU banks attractive, domestic demand key; earnings, not valuations, will bring FIIs back: Raamdeo Agrawal
articles.summary: Raamdeo Agrawal, Chairman of Motilal Oswal says PSU banks are among the cheapest opportunities today after years of cleanup. He expects credit growth and domestic demand to drive a multiplier effect, sees earnings picking up over the next year, and warns that excessive valuations—not weak businesses—are behind recent stock corrections.

articles.title: Why fixed-income investors should shift focus from duration to yield in 2026, says Shriram Ramanathan
articles.summary: Indian bond markets are shifting after a strong rally. Investors should now focus on stable returns from attractive yields and selective credit. Aggressive duration bets are less advisable. Opportunities exist in money markets, State Development Loans, and short-term corporate bonds. Currency stability and global developments will also shape investor interest in 2026.

articles.title: US revokes over 100,000 visas so far amid Trump crackdown; deportations to continue
articles.summary: America's State Department has cancelled over 100,000 visas this year. This action targets foreign nationals with criminal records or legal issues. The department states this is to keep America safe. This move affects tourists, students, and skilled workers. Indians, a large group of visa holders, are impacted. India is raising these concerns with Washington.

articles.title: Policy speculation triggers sharp fall in Capital Goods shares
articles.summary: Capital goods stocks faced pressure on Thursday. Reports suggested the government might reconsider allowing Chinese firms in project bids. This news impacted BHEL and other domestic manufacturers. Experts advise caution, noting the development is speculative. Official confirmation is awaited. Any change could alter the competitive landscape for Indian companies.

articles.title: Rupee recovers after fresh RBI intervention, follow-through uncertain
articles.summary: The Indian rupee saw a rebound on Thursday following intervention by the Reserve Bank of India, though its long-term stability remains a concern for bankers. Despite the RBI's efforts to strengthen the currency, experts advise importers to hedge against potential future depreciation due to an uncertain trade deal outlook and subdued foreign inflows.

articles.title: Sensex sheds over 1,100 points in 3 days, Nifty slips 1%: 4 key factors behind the stock market decline
articles.summary: Indian equities extended losses for a third straight session as selling in heavyweight stocks, Venezuela-driven geopolitical tensions and weak global cues dragged the Sensex and Nifty lower. Benchmark indices slipped sharply throughout the week, mirroring risk-off sentiment across global markets and heightened volatility driven by macro uncertainty and large-cap pressure.

articles.title: Nvidia at CES 2026; Puneet Kumar quits Nexus
articles.summary: AI chipmaker Nvidia put forward its vision to own the AI stack at CES 2026 in Las Vegas. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: 'Mogambo Khush Hua': Kharge likens Trump to iconic villain, questions Modi’s silence
The unnatural beauty of Dhurandhar: Why Aditya Dhar's polarising film works as pure cinema
articles.summary: A visually arresting, fiercely polarising action thriller, Dhurandhar transcends propaganda debates through raw performances, brutal choreography, and an uncanny portrayal of familiar worlds rendered disturbingly strange.

articles.title: ET Prime Special: Macro the mightiest - Part 8: How to read the yield curve, and use it to gain an edge in the markets
articles.summary: This series is for investors who are keen to understand the nuts and bolts of an economy. Now, investors are constantly searching for a reliable crystal ball that accurately predicts the future. While no indicator is perfect, one has come closer than any other: The yield curve. A specific, peculiar behaviour of the yield curve, known as an inversion, has preceded most major economic recessions in the US. When this happens, it’s as if the bond market – often considered the “smart money” in the ro

articles.title: Union Budget: How 8 Budgets presented by FM Sitharaman reshaped India's power game
articles.summary: India Budget 2026: Nirmala Sitharaman's eight Budgets navigated India through economic slowdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic with a pragmatic approach. She balanced fiscal discipline with strategic capital expenditure and welfare support, laying the groundwork for India's 'Viksit Bharat' ambition. Her tenure focused on long-term growth and resilience amidst global headwinds.

articles.title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
articles.summary: Had it not been for the hit taken by the ITC stock, the Nifty and Sensex would have ended much higher on the first trading day of 2026. Again, however the indices move in the next couple of sessions, remember that a large majority of institutional investors will be back in office only by Monday or Tuesday. So, whether you decide to be bullish or bearish in the short- to medium-term horizon, let the hangover of the New Year party get over.

articles.title: One of America’s most successful experiments with Indians is coming to a shuddering halt
articles.summary: A prominent Hindu deity statue inauguration in Texas sparks protests and political backlash. This incident highlights growing anti-Indian sentiment in America. Highly skilled Indian immigrants, long seen as a success story, now face challenges. Visa policies and rhetoric are impacting their ability to work and live in the US. This shift questions America's welcoming image for global talent.

articles.title: Ties with India witness a downturn as Bangladesh navigates turbulent 2025
articles.summary: Bangladesh faced a turbulent 2025 marked by political upheaval and economic hardship. Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's ouster led to strained relations with India. The nation experienced a shift towards conservatism and a rise in anti-India sentiment. Economic challenges persisted, with concerns over debt and corruption.

articles.title: Rs 66,500 crore boom in 5 days! Rail stocks roar back on track after a 17-month slump
articles.summary: Indian railway stocks are roaring back after a 17-month slump. A Rs 66,500 crore boom in market value has occurred in just five days. Investors are repositioning ahead of the Union Budget. Improving revenue signals and fare rationalization are driving this comeback. Key stocks like Jupiter Wagons and RVNL have seen substantial gains.

articles.title: Why active investing could outperform passive strategies in 2026
articles.summary: As 2026 approaches, experts suggest active, selective investing may outperform passive strategies amid wide dispersion in earnings and valuations. Largecaps remain strong, midcaps show steady growth, while smallcaps lag. Investors are advised to focus on bottom-up stock selection, thematic plays, and balanced allocation across equities, commodities, and debt.

articles.title: IEX shares slide over 4% after CERC rolls out VPPA framework
articles.summary: Shares of Indian Energy Exchange fell sharply after CERC introduced a framework for Virtual Power Purchase Agreements, raising concerns over potential impact on exchange-based power trading volumes amid broader regulatory uncertainty.

articles.title: Delhi Metro phase 5A approved: 13 stations, 16 km corridor at ₹12,015 crore
India’s manufacturing woes: Rahul Gandhi’s prescription for job creation
School assembly news headlines for December 23: Top national, international business & sports updates
articles.summary: Political sparring intensifies with a jibe at Akhilesh Yadav, while a former Trinamool leader criticizes Mamata Banerjee. International news includes NASA's diamond-planet discovery and a former child star's homelessness. Sports headlines feature Usman Khawaja's family facing abuse, and business news highlights soaring gold prices and Thailand's popularity as an Indian holiday spot.

articles.title: Vivek Ramaswamy mauled in MAGA bloodletting as Trump devotees turn on each other
articles.summary: A conservative conference saw prominent MAGA figures engage in bitter public disputes. Vivek Ramaswamy faced backlash for his remarks on anti-Indian hate. Ben Shapiro criticized Tucker Carlson and Candace Owens. Steve Bannon also attacked Shapiro. The event became a spectacle of internal conflict, with accusations of antisemitism and conspiracy theories dominating the proceedings.

articles.title: ICICI Lombard sees strong demand in motor, health even as growth costs bite
articles.summary: Gopal Balachandran, Chief Financial Officer of ICICI Lombard, said the company is encouraged by the rise in consumer demand following recent regulatory reforms. He pointed to strong momentum in the retail health segment, where ICICI Lombard’s market share increased to 4.5% in the third quarter, up from around 3% in previous years.

articles.title: India’s wholesale inflation rises to 0.83% in November
articles.summary: The Wholesale Price Index, or WPI, measures the change in prices of goods that wholesale businesses sell to and trade in bulk with other companies. Unlike the CPI, which tracks prices of goods and services purchased by consumers, WPI tracks factory gate prices before retail prices.

articles.title: Renault unveils Filante as flagship hybrid SUV, South Korea launch set for 2026
articles.summary: Renault has revealed the Filante as its new global flagship SUV, built on Geely’s CMA platform and produced in Busan, with sales starting in South Korea in March 2026 and expansion planned for Gulf and Latin American markets.

articles.title: Meta begins job cuts as it shifts gears from VR to AI wearables
articles.summary: With this, the Facebook-owner is stepping scaling down its efforts on Virtual Reality (VR) and "metaverse-first" vision which created a lot of buzz during the pandemic and prompted the tech giant to rename itself as Meta in October 2021. The Reality Labs, created around the same time, has lost more than $70 billion since then.

articles.title: Row erupts in Kerala over halting of bridge construction for ‘Kumbh mela’
articles.summary: Kerala revenue officials halted a temporary bridge for Maha Magha festival at Bharathapuzha, sparking protests from organisers and leaders like Kummanam Rajasekharan over religious freedom concerns.

articles.title: India ranks 80 in Henley Passport Index 2026 with visa-free access to 55 countries
articles.summary: India has climbed five places to rank 80th on the Henley Passport Index 2026, allowing Indian passport holders visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to 55 countries, while Asian nations continue to dominate the top spots.

articles.title: Indus Towers will be a 'key beneficiary' of Vodafone Idea relief; CLSA projects 32% upside
articles.summary: According to CLSA, Indus Towers is a key beneficiary of Vodafone Idea's relief on adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues as well as its ongoing fund-raising efforts.

articles.title: CM Fadnavis does not rule out Ajit and Sharad Pawar factions coming together in future
articles.summary: Devendra Fadnavis says Sharad Pawar and Ajit Pawar's NCP factions may reunite, citing local alliances in Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad, but calls it a limited arrangement amid civic polls.

articles.title: US files for warrants to seize dozens more Venezuela-linked oil tankers
articles.summary: The exact number of seizure warrants the US has filed for, and how many it has already received, is unclear because the filings and legal orders are not public.

articles.title: Trade deal hopes can boost mood, but earnings matter more: BofA's Arbind Maheswari
articles.summary: BofA Securities’ Arbind Maheswari said progress in India-US trade talks could improve market sentiment, but long-term returns will depend on earnings growth. He expects about 14% earnings growth this year and a 12% Nifty return driven mainly by profits, with foreign outflows likely to ease and policy support helping the economy over time.

articles.title: Apple unveils Creator Studio: What is it and who is it for
articles.summary: The suite, available on the App Store from January 28, offers a range of professional-grade tools, including Final Cut Pro, Logic Pro, Pixelmator Pro, Motion, Compressor, and MainStage.

articles.title: Construction crane falls on passenger train in northeastern Thailand, killing at least 22 people
articles.summary: The crane, which was being used to construct an elevated high-speed railway, fell onto the moving train as it was travelling from Bangkok to Ubon Ratchathani province, causing the train to derail and catch fire.

articles.title: 11:11| Freezing frontier, falling Dow Jones, Kotak Bank's stock split, Trump's tariff threat and more
articles.summary: Good morning! Today's edition of 11:11 takes a look at the dropping mercury in Northern India, Dow Jones falls over 400 points after JPMorgan's decline, Kotak Bank's stock split, the consequence of Trump's tariff threat against Iran's trading partner and more

articles.title: Eternal, Swiggy share price target cut by UBS on rising quick commerce competition
articles.summary: The recent correction in stock prices, coupled with a still strong growth outlook, keeps us positive on the quick commerce sector, UBS said in its note.

articles.title: Mixed performance likely for oil and gas in third quarter of FY26
articles.summary: Dayanand Mittal, Oil & Gas Analyst at JM Financial Institutional Securities said his preference remains with upstream oil companies such as ONGC and Oil India over oil marketing companies (OMCs). He believes OMCs are currently undertaking aggressive capital expenditure in refining and petrochemicals, which could be value destructive from a minority shareholder perspective.

articles.title: Infosys Q3 Results Live Updates: Stock remains in green ahead of report, all eyes on guidance
articles.summary: Infosys Q3 Results Live Updates: Shares of technology services provider Infosys Ltd. are trading with losses ahead of the Bengaluru-based IT firm reporting its third quarter earnings after market closing hours today. All eyes will be on the company's guidance, deal wins and the path towards AI. Watch this space for all the live updates.

articles.title: Tamil Nadu to set up India's first Sovereign AI Park: What it offers
articles.summary: Tamil Nadu and Sarvam AI signed an MoU to launch India’s first Sovereign AI Park, investing ₹10,000 crores to boost AI jobs, research, and Tamil-first digital innovation.

articles.title: How a palak paneer lunch led to $200,000 settlement for two Indian students in US
articles.summary: Aditya Prakash and his partner, fellow PhD scholar Urmi Bhattacheryya, alleged that the incident marked the start of discriminatory treatment and institutional retaliation leading to a federal civil rights lawsuit with the University of Colorado Boulder. Read on:

articles.title: Fed is not losing independence, but it may be losing focus: William Lee
articles.summary: William Lee, Chief Economist & MD at Global Economic Advisors said US tariffs are likely to remain a permanent feature of the global economic landscape, driven not just by policy preferences but by fiscal necessity.

articles.title: SBI Securities sees Nifty earnings growth returning to double-digits in FY27
articles.summary: Sunny Agarwal, Head of Fundamental Research, Retail Desk at SBI Securities, said investors should be selective in real estate, favouring large, pan-India developers with strong balance sheets, as they are better placed to deliver earnings growth while smaller regional players may face continued headwinds.

articles.title: Redtape shares fall 7% after promoters clarify on reports of stake monetisation plans
articles.summary: At the end of the September quarter, promoters of Redtape had a 71.8% stake in the company. The shareholding for the December quarter is yet to be disclosed.

articles.title: Trump vs Supreme Court on tariffs: US President warns of ‘alternatives’ if policy is struck down
articles.summary: Donald Trump warned that an adverse ruling would have wide-ranging consequences, including the potential obligation to return “hundreds of billions” of dollars collected through tariffs. He also alleged that opposition to the tariffs was influenced by pro-China interests, arguing that resistance benefits Beijing. Read on:

articles.title: L&T announces another order win but analysts cut estimates on middle east concerns, flag risks
articles.summary: Shares of L T are down for the fifth straight day on Wednesday even as the company announced another "large" order win. Analysts have warned of a potential cap on L T's near-term share price upside.

articles.title: BMC elections: No voter ID? You can still cast your vote with these documents
articles.summary: BMC polls on Jan 15: 1,700 candidates in 227 wards. Voters need photo ID or approved documents. Special facilities for disabled ensured.

articles.title: Indian Oil reports unconventional oil discovery in Abu Dhabi block; Stock in focus
articles.summary: The discovery was made through Urja Bharat Pte Limited, the special purpose vehicle jointly operated by Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat PetroResources, a wholly owned subsidiary of Bharat Petroleum Corporation, in a 50:50 partnership.

articles.title: Analysts suggest buy calls on Tata Steel, Chennai Petro, Tata Elxsi, Colgate, Bosch
articles.summary: On Wednesday, market tech analysts Vinay Rajani and Mitessh Thakkar recommended these stocks for the short term.

articles.title: ‘No confusion, no rumours’: Ajit Pawar clarifies police visit to NCP strategist’s office
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar reiterated the party’s support for Naresh Arora and DesignBoxed, saying the NCP respects legal processes but will not allow the spread of “confusion, rumours, or unnecessary narratives” lacking factual basis. Read more:

articles.title: Explained — The major reason behind the recent selling pressure in Dixon Technologies
articles.summary: Earlier in the day on Wednesday, Ambit Capital cut its price target on Dixon Technologies to ₹11,275 from ₹11,868 earlier, while maintaining its "sell" rating on the stock.

articles.title: US approves Nvidia H200 chip exports to China with some conditions
articles.summary: Trump administration approved Nvidia H200 AI chip sales to China with export caps, and security checks, sparking debate over US national security and enforcement challenges.

articles.title: Checking into these two hotel stocks could fetch you up to 22% returns, Nomura says
articles.summary: While ITC Hotels remains a "consensus buy" among all 11 analysts that track the stock, majority of the analysts covering Indian Hotels also have a "buy" rating on the Tata Group stock.

articles.title: Clintons refuse to testify in House Epstein probe as Republicans threaten contempt proceedings
articles.summary: Bill Clinton and Hillary Clinton refuse a House subpoena on Jeffrey Epstein, sparking contempt proceedings as Congress debates DOJ delays and bipartisan calls for Epstein files release.

articles.title: Donald Trump vs Jerome Powell: US president doubles down his attack on Fed chair, calls him 'crooked'
articles.summary: Powell claimed on Sunday night that the DOJ threatened a "criminal indictment" and sent grand jury subpoenas in response to his earlier Senate testimony regarding the continuing renovations of the central bank office buildings.

articles.title: Scott Adams, the man behind Dilbert, dies at 68 leaving a final farewell message: ‘Be useful’
articles.summary: Scott Adams, creator of Dilbert and polarising commentator, died at 68. His farewell urged usefulness and love, leaving a legacy in office satire and self-help.

articles.title: Just Dial shares in focus after Q3 results; Citi cuts price target, growth estimates
articles.summary: Citi has lowered its growth estimates and multiples on Just Dial to 10 times from 12 times earlier, due to continued decline in traffic.

articles.title: RailTel shares drop after Bihar education projects worth over ₹600 crore cancelled
articles.summary: RailTel Corporation of India informed the bourses about the cancellation of multiple work orders with a combined value of approximately ₹609.56 crore.

articles.title: Greenland PM prefers Denmark ties over US ahead of Vance meeting
articles.summary: Trump's administration has repeatedly claimed Greenland's strategic importance to US national security. White House officials have been discussing various plans to bring Greenland under US control, including potential use of the US military and lump-sum payments to Greenlanders as part of a bid to convince them to secede from Denmark.

articles.title: Shadowfax IPO: ₹1,907-crore issue opens next week; check price band and other details
