articles.summary: The IPO of logistics services provider Shadowfax will comprise fresh issue of shares worth ₹1,000 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of ₹907 crore by existing shareholders.

articles.title: US to revoke citizenship of naturalised migrants convicted of fraud, Trump says
articles.summary: Aides have said that this year, ahead of the midterms, Trump is set to travel around the country to directly speak to voters about his economic accomplishments.

articles.title: ONGC, Oil India shares gain for fourth straight day on elevated crude prices
articles.summary: While shares of both ONGC and Oil India have outperformed in the last three sessions, their returns over the last 12 months are in the negative.

articles.title: Jaishankar, Rubio discuss trade, critical minerals and energy amid India-US $500 billion trade push
articles.summary: The conversation comes as New Delhi and Washington attempt to rebuild momentum in bilateral economic engagement after stalled trade negotiations last year unsettled markets and pressured the rupee.

articles.title: Public insurers told to chase profits, younger customers and full digitalisation
articles.summary: DFS, led by M. Nagaraju, reviewed LIC, GIC, NIACL, NICL, UIICL, OICL and AICIL, focusing on profitability, digital onboarding, and customer reforms for FY 2024–25 and 2025–26.

articles.title: UPI user base can more than double to 1 billion: RBI Deputy Governor
articles.summary: Reserve Bank Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar says UPI can grow to 1 billion users, driving financial inclusion and GDP, with global expansion in countries like Singapore, UAE, Nepal, and France.

articles.title: World faces massive jobs test as 1.2 billion young people near working age: World Bank
articles.summary: The World Bank warns that 1.2 billion young people will enter developing-world labour markets by 2035, making job creation, investment and reforms critical to avoid unemployment and unrest.

articles.title: Global economy holds up despite trade tensions, but developing world still lags: World Bank
articles.summary: One in four developing economies remains poorer than before the pandemic; jobs challenge looms as 1.2 billion youth enter workforce

articles.title: Indian rice exports struggle, but home demand is rising: Kribhco Agri
articles.summary: Rajesh Paharia, Chief Manager–Business Development at Kribhco Agri Business, said Indian rice exporters were already facing delayed payments, currency weakness, banking constraints and rising logistics costs, and that the new tariff has compounded these challenges, increasing risks for those exposed to the Iranian market.

articles.title: Women still locked out of real finance despite 90% bank account coverage: Report
articles.summary: Inclusive Finance India Report 2025 flags inactive accounts, low financial literacy and a 35% MSME credit gap as key barriers to women’s economic agency.

articles.title: How AI can help Ujjwala deliver its next gains
articles.summary: AI can help India shift PMUY from mass access to precision—targeting electric cooking where grids allow, cutting LPG imports, subsidies, and sustaining clean-cooking gains nationwide.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Real estate sector seeks tax realism, faster approvals and infra-led growth
articles.summary: As Budget 2026 approaches, India’s real estate sector is seeking policy clarity on taxes, approvals and affordability as rising costs and shifting demand reshape the housing market. Developers say targeted reforms and infrastructure push could be critical to sustaining momentum across residential, commercial and Tier II city developments.

articles.title: US consumer prices likely stayed elevated in December as data recovers from shutdown
articles.summary: The figures are harder to predict this month, however, because the six-week government shutdown last fall suspended the collection of price data used to compile the inflation rate. Some economists expect the December figures to show a bigger jump in inflation as the data collection process gets back to normal.

articles.title: New labour rules will make hiring costlier, say staffing firms
articles.summary: Executives from TeamLease Services and Info Edge said India’s new labour codes will increase PF and ESI contributions due to a standardised wage definition, raising compliance costs for companies. However, TeamLease said the impact can be absorbed within one annual increment cycle. Info Edge cautioned that higher hiring costs may pressure corporate margins. For gig and quick commerce firms, the shift may largely replace private insurance spending with government social security contributions, li

articles.title: US-Taiwan trade deal on the horizon; focus on chipmaking in United States
articles.summary: As per reports, the import duties would drop from the current 20% to 15%. At that level, Taiwan's shipments would be comparable to those from South Korea and Japan, both of which signed deals last year.

articles.title: Japanese bonds decline as PM Takaichi gears up for political gamble
articles.summary: As rumours that Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi could dissolve parliament and hold elections emerged, the yield on 30-year bonds increased by 12 basis points to 3.52%, while 10-year bond futures dropped by 71 ticks.

articles.title: No formal India-US trade talks scheduled this week despite Ambassador Gor’s remarks: Sources
articles.summary: Despite US Ambassador Sergio Gor signalling progress on India-US trade talks, Indian government sources say no formal discussions are scheduled this week. Informal engagement continues, and India’s participation in the US-led PAX Silica Initiative has boosted critical mineral stocks.

articles.title: CII asks govt to invest in railways and factories, cut fuel taxes, and put money back in people’s pockets
articles.summary: As Budget Day approaches, industry body CII is calling for a sharp increase in infrastructure spending, a renewed PPP push, and structural reforms in taxation and financing to revive consumption and strengthen manufacturing competitiveness.

articles.title: India Inc wants a GST-style customs reboot in Budget 2026 to cut delays and unlock cash
articles.summary: Industry experts say a GST-style overhaul of customs—covering duty slab rationalisation, deeper digitisation, and a one-time amnesty for legacy disputes—could significantly reduce clearance delays, unlock stuck working capital, and improve India’s trade competitiveness in the coming years.

articles.title: RBI notifies Foreign Exchange Management (Guarantees) Regulations, 2026
articles.summary: RBI’s new Foreign Exchange Management (Guarantees) Regulations, 2026, bar residents from participating in guarantees involving non-residents unless FEMA-compliant, expand guarantee definitions, and mandate quarterly reporting through AD banks with penalties for delays.

articles.title: Cheaper food drags retail inflation down, but the relief may be short
articles.summary: Kotak Institutional Equities Chief Economist Suvodeep Rakshit said the December print gives the RBI comfort ahead of its February 6 MPC policy meeting, as inflation remains well below the lower bound of the target range.

articles.title: India's inflation at three-month high in December, but undershoots poll
articles.summary: India’s retail inflation came in at 1.33% in December, below CNBC-TV18 estimates, as soft food prices offset sequential pressure across rural, urban and core consumption segments.

articles.title: Indian banks look strongest in 15 years, but Crisil flags these risks
articles.summary: Krishnan Sitaraman, Chief Ratings Officer at Crisil Ratings, said the agency is closely monitoring pressure points, especially export-oriented sectors with exposure to the US market.

articles.title: The anatomy of India’s consumer sector: Has policy finally met behaviour?
articles.summary: Q3FY26 shows cautious recovery in India’s consumption, with rising credit card spends, strong rural auto sales, FMCG volume growth, and digital transactions, but urban demand remains subdued.

articles.title: Textile exporters struggle as US tariff pain drags on
articles.summary: Pallab Banerjee, MD & Group President of Pearl Global, said that many smaller textile players are likely to exit the business if the situation does not improve soon, which could lead to job losses and some factory closures in India.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026: Here is all you need to know about this crucial document on state of the economy
articles.summary: Presented in Parliament a day before the Budget, the Economic Survey is best described as India’s economic report card and roadmap rolled into one. It reviews how the economy performed over the fiscal year, from growth, inflation, and jobs to trade and fiscal health — and flags challenges and opportunities.

articles.title: Donald Trump denies role in DoJ's investigation into Fed chair Jerome Powell
articles.summary: Trump denied any role in DOJ subpoenas tied to the Federal Reserve as Powell warned of political pressure and lawmakers raised concerns about the Fed’s independence.

articles.title: Finance Minister chairs pre-Budget consultation with States, UTs ahead of Budget 2026
articles.summary: Nirmala Sitharaman chaired a pre-Budget meeting in New Delhi with States and Union Territories ahead of the 2026–27 Union Budget, set for February 1, marking her ninth presentation.

articles.title: Shed colonial mindset, trust Indian capability: Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw to railway officials
articles.summary: Addressing senior officials at the Ati Vishisht Rail Seva Puraskar ceremony, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw laid out a reform-driven roadmap for Indian Railways, emphasising technology adoption, safety, advanced training and wider collaboration with startups to position the national transporter as a global benchmark by 2047.

articles.title: India confident of dealing with headwinds from ‘known, unknown sources’: Principal Secy to PM Shaktikanta Das
articles.summary: Principal Secretary to the PM Shaktikanta Das highlights India's resilience amid global shocks, outlining challenges and strategies for Viksit Bharat and continued economic growth.

articles.title: Government plans changes to National Highways Act to fast-track road projects
articles.summary: The government is considering amendments to the National Highways Act to ease land acquisition, cut litigation and speed up highway construction, with proposals likely to be tabled in Parliament’s Budget Session.

articles.title: CBIC flags fake GST notices, advises taxpayers to verify DIN
articles.summary: The CBIC on Friday flagged fake GST notices being sent to businesses and asked taxpayers to report such frauds immediately.

articles.title: US adds fewer jobs than expected in December, unemployment rate declines
articles.summary: US job growth cooled sharply in December, with weak hiring, downward revisions and mixed labour signals, even as falling unemployment and strong consumption kept the broader economic outlook resilient.

articles.title: India cuts US Treasury holdings by 21% in 2025, signals reserve diversification
articles.summary: India’s US Treasury holdings fell 21% to $190.7 billion dollars in 2025, reflecting a strategic shift toward gold and non-dollar assets amid global uncertainty.

articles.title: UBS explains why the rupee’s troubles may not be over yet
articles.summary: UBS’s Rohit Arora expects the rupee to remain under pressure, pegging dollar-rupee at 94 for the year due to weak capital flows, current account concerns and a recovering US dollar. He said any trade deal-led support may be temporary, with limited upside for the rupee. UBS remains more positive on the Chinese renminbi among Asian currencies.

articles.title: India’s consumption recovery: When Goldman Sachs expects demand to pick up
articles.summary: Santanu Sengupta, Chief India Economist at Goldman Sachs, said urban credit growth has already started to recover, helped by regulatory easing from the RBI..

articles.title: Why India’s credit system needs accountability in distribution
articles.summary: Loans represent some of the largest and longest tenure financial decisions made by households and MSMEs, yet those intermediating these decisions face no market wide requirements for training, testing or continuing education, notes Shachindra Nath, Founder & Managing Director, UGRO Capital.

articles.title: US Supreme court likely to rule on Trump tariffs today; What is at stake here?
articles.summary: While it is not guaranteed that the Supreme Court will issue its verdict, it has designated Friday as a “decision day” for releasing opinions, and many anticipate that the tariff case will be addressed.

articles.title: Global cooperation showing resilience despite geopolitical headwinds: WEF study
articles.summary: The barometer indicated that the overall level of cooperation has largely been unchanged in recent years, but the composition of cooperation appears to be evolving.

articles.title: Most of Wall Street drifts as defence companies rocket higher
articles.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 109 points, or 0.2 per cent, as of 9:35 am Eastern time, and the Nasdaq composite was 0.4 per cent lower.

articles.title: GDP to grow by 7.5 pc in FY26, says SBI report
articles.summary: The First Advance Estimates released by the National Statistics Office (NSO) on Wednesday put GDP growth in 2025-26 at 7.4 per cent as compared to 6.5 per cent in the previous fiscal. The RBI has projected the growth rate at 7.3 per cent.

articles.title: Sanctions rhetoric vs market reality: Why oil prices may stay soft and Indian refiners could still gain
articles.summary: As Washington sharpens its sanctions language on Russian oil, analysts caution that structural oversupply, rising global inventories and pragmatic enforcement limits are likely to keep crude prices under pressure. For India, the evolving mix of discounted Russian barrels and softer heavy crude markets could translate into steadier feedstock costs and improved refining margins, even as geopolitical risks persist.

articles.title: Budget 2026: EY pitches TDS simplification for ease of doing business, seeks consolidation
articles.summary: EY has urged the government to simplify the tax deducted at source framework by sharply reducing the number of rates and eliminating low-rate TDS on GST-covered transactions, arguing that the current system creates avoidable compliance burdens without adding meaningful oversight.

articles.title: Saks Global nearing $1.75 billion financing plan ahead of bankruptcy filing: report
articles.summary: Driven by the vision of real estate investor Richard Baker, Canada-based conglomerate Hudson's Bay Co, which had owned Saks since 2013, bought rival Neiman Marcus in 2024 for $2.65 billion and spun off its US luxury assets to create Saks Global. The plan was to more easily take on competitors like Bloomingdale's and Nordstrom by bringing together two of America's best-known department store chains.

articles.title: India proposes annual revisions to industrial output weights to reflect economic shifts
articles.summary: The proposal forms part of a broader federal push to overhaul key economic data series by revising base years and updating methods to better match the current economic structure.

articles.title: Firstsource Solutions acquires TeleMedik for $3 million to expand US healthcare presence
articles.summary: Firstsource Solutions’ step-down subsidiary, Firstsource Health Plans and Healthcare Services, LLC, has acquired 100% of TeleMedik, a Puerto Rico-based healthcare and telehealth solutions provider, for up to $3 million.

articles.title: Trump’s Iran tariff threat puts India’s rice, tea exporters on the edge
articles.summary: Indian exporters with significant exposure to Iran are grappling with shipment uncertainty, rising logistics costs and delayed payments after US President Donald Trump threatened sweeping tariffs on countries trading with Tehran, even as New Delhi assesses a regulatory framework to manage sector-specific risks.

articles.title: Top Stories | Trump’s Iran tariff threat, AI deal reshapes tech, NSE IPO view and more
Interarch Building Solutions bags ₹130 crore order for pre-engineered steel building system
articles.summary: Interarch Building Solutions has secured a domestic order worth about ₹130 crore for the design, engineering, manufacturing, supply, and erection of a pre-engineered steel building system, to be executed over 17 months with a 10% advance.

articles.title: RBI seeks public feedback on NBFC, ARC capital rule tweaks
articles.summary: Reserve Bank of India seeks public feedback on draft amendments clarifying Owned Fund and Tier 1 Capital norms for NBFCs and ARCs, with comments open until January 28, 2026.

articles.title: SkinInspired raises ₹24 crore to build in-house lab as repeat buyers drive growth
articles.summary: The fresh Series A capital will enable SkinInspired to bring critical formulation and testing capabilities in-house, reduce dependence on third-party labs, and accelerate new product launches as the brand sharpens its focus on science-led, dermatologist-backed skincare in a crowded D2C market.

articles.title: Just Dial Q3 Results | Net profit falls 10% to ₹118 crore despite revenue growth
articles.summary: EBITDA increased 9.6% year-on-year to ₹95.2 crore in Q3, compared with ₹86.8 crore a year earlier. The EBITDA margin improved to 31.1% from 30.2% in the corresponding quarter last year.

articles.title: Sanjay Agarwal: AU Bank scaled tenfold despite COVID, rate shocks, NBFC crisis
articles.summary: Sanjay Agarwal credits AU Small Finance Bank’s tenfold growth to disciplined risk management, tech adoption, and mentorship from Raamdeo Agrawal, aiming for long-term institutional success.

articles.title: Uday Kotak family office USK Capital acquires majority stake in US healthy-snacking brand Go Raw
articles.summary: USK Capital, the family office of Uday Kotak, has acquired a majority stake in US-based seed-centric snacking brand Go Raw, marking its first overseas and consumer sector investment.

articles.title: Cybersecurity firm CloudSEK raises USD 10 mn from Connecticut Innovations
articles.summary: The predictive cyber threat intelligence firm has raised the funds at an enterprise valuation of close to USD 200 million. With this round, the company has raised USD 39 million to date.

articles.title: US tariff on Iran trade partners unlikely to impact India: Govt
articles.summary: India’s trade with Iran accounts for just 0.15% of total trade, government sources say, with trade value expected to subside further.

articles.title: ICICI Lombard Q3 Results | Net profit falls 9% as combined ratio worsens to 105%
articles.summary: ICICI Lombard reported a 9% year-on-year decline in Q3 net profit to ₹659 crore as a higher combined ratio offset double-digit growth in total income and net premium earned. Net income increased 12%.

articles.title: Is 10-minute delivery banned? Experts say no, tagline removal largely optics
articles.summary: Quick commerce platforms, including Blinkit, Zepto and Swiggy, have reportedly been asked to scale back '10-minute delivery' branding after a government nudge. Industry experts say the move is largely optics-driven, not business-altering.

articles.title: IRDAI set to release consultation paper on capping insurance commissions next month
articles.summary: According to sources, IRDAI may propose a return to segmental commission caps, similar to the older regulatory framework. This would mean setting separate commission limits for different insurance categories such as motor, health, term life, and other life and general insurance segments.

articles.title: Beauty startup VCare targets market leadership, IPO in 1-2 years: CEO
articles.summary: With a market turnover nearing ₹400 crore and a target to become India's number one aesthetic brand in the next fiscal, VCare is laying the groundwork for an IPO, expected in the next 1-2 years after consolidation of its North India operations.

articles.title: Metropolis plans to expand genomics test menu to 500 in next two years
articles.summary: Metropolis Healthcare has launched a Centre for Genomics to expand its specialty diagnostics business. The company plans to increase its genomics test menu from 220 to 500 over the next two years and integrate testing with genetic counselling and clinical expertise. Specialty tests already contribute about 38% of revenue and are expected to grow further. Metropolis is targeting 13–15% organic growth in FY26 and FY27 and will continue selective acquisitions while expanding radiology services.

articles.title: Lemon Tree to turn debt-free, Fleur listing next after Warburg deal: Patanjali Keswani
articles.summary: Lemon Tree Hotels will split its subsidiary Fleur Hotels into a separately listed company and bring in Warburg Pincus as a strategic investor. Warburg will buy APG’s 41.09% stake and invest up to ₹960 crore as fresh capital. Fleur is expected to list in 12–15 months and use the funds for expansion and room acquisitions. Most of the group’s debt will move to Fleur, leaving Lemon Tree Hotels debt-free after the restructuring.

articles.title: Founders of India's RedTape eye stake sale, tap Blackstone, KKR, says report
articles.summary: RedTape founders, the Mirzas, may sell a majority or full stake worth up to $510 million, with Blackstone and KKR approached by EY. RedTape competes with Nike, Adidas, and Bata India.

articles.title: BCCL coal mine collapses in Asansol; illegal mining suspected, many feared trapped
articles.summary: Rescue operation was underway as rescue teams rushed to the spot as many people are also feared to be injured in the accident.

articles.title: GRIDCO moves Supreme Court against APTEL order on ₹280 crore dues to GMR Kamalanga
articles.summary: GRIDCO Ltd has moved the Supreme Court against APTEL's order to pay GMR Kamalanga Energy Ltd around ₹280 crore for fixed capacity charges and surcharge for April 2015 to March 2017.

articles.title: Amid surge in AI memory demand, SK Hynix to invest $13 billion in new chip packaging facility
articles.summary: SK Hynix will invest 12.9 billion dollars in a new chip packaging facility in Cheongju to address global memory chip shortages and strengthen its AI memory market leadership.

articles.title: RBI may have to buy more bonds to check borrowing rates
articles.summary: India’s central bank has pumped in more money in the last two years than in the five preceding years combined. Yet, market borrowing rates show no signs of cooling off.

articles.title: 11:11 | CPC delegation meets BJP in Delhi, markets in wait-and-watch on US-Iran tensions, Neville Tata’s Trusts entry
articles.summary: A delegation from the Communist Party of China has visited the BJP headquarters in Delhi, global markets remain cautious amid rising US-Iran tensions, and the Pentagon is embracing Elon Musk’s Grok AI chatbot despite global outcry. Meanwhile, sources told CNBC-TV18 that Neville Tata is likely to be inducted into the board of the Sir Ratan Tata Trusts this week.

articles.title: Neville Tata likely to join Sir Ratan Tata Trusts board this week
articles.summary: Since 2016, Neville Tata has been a part of Trent and is currently in charge of the rapidly expanding fashion brand Zudio. After internal conflicts between Noel Tata's faction and those of Mehli Mistry, a close ally of the late Ratan Tata, were resolved, he was inducted into the trusts.

articles.title: Over 15,000 nurses go on strike at several major New York City hospitals
articles.summary: About 15,000 nurses are involved in the strike, according to their union, the New York State Nurses Association. The hospitals remained open, hiring droves of temporary nurses to try to fill the labour gap.

articles.title: Former Trump adviser Dina Powell McCormick named Meta's president
articles.summary: Powell McCormick spent 16 years in senior leadership roles at Goldman Sachs. She served as Deputy National Security Adviser to Trump during his first term and as a senior White House adviser under former President George W. Bush.

articles.title: ‘Pax Silica’ invitation shows India’s rising influence in AI and critical minerals: IT Secretary S Krishnan
articles.summary: India’s inclusion in the US-led ‘Pax Silica’ initiative and critical minerals discussions underscores its growing reputation as a reliable partner in global supply chains. Officials say this recognition aligns with India’s ambition to become a world hub for AI applications.

articles.title: Ahead of IPO, Amagi Media Labs mobilises ₹805 cr from anchor investors
articles.summary: Amagi Media Labs raised ₹805 crore from anchor investors ahead of its ₹1,789-crore IPO, with SBI MF, ICICI Prudential MF, and HDFC MF among key participants. IPO opens January 13.

articles.title: JP Morgan leases 2.71 lakh sq ft office space from Cowrks in Mumbai at ₹9 cr monthly rent
articles.summary: The starting monthly rent is ₹339.4 per sq ft translating into ₹9.23 crore for a month.

articles.title: Inside Boeing’s factories: How the aircraft maker is trying to fix its safety and quality crisis
articles.summary: From slowing production to tightening inspections, Boeing is reshaping how its jets are built as regulators keep a close watch. A CNBC-TV18 visit across the aircraft maker’s US factories reveals how changes on the shop floor are aimed at preventing past mistakes from recurring.

articles.title: TCS job cuts now bigger than the entire workforce of many Nifty 50 firms
articles.summary: TCS has cut over 30,000 jobs in six months as profits slide, costs rise and AI-led restructuring accelerates across India’s largest IT employer globally base.

articles.title: Bluecopa raises $7.5 million to kill month-end closures: How the money will reshape finance teams
articles.summary: As CFOs grapple with real-time reporting demands and shrinking tolerance for errors, Hyderabad-based Bluecopa is betting that the traditional month-end close is obsolete. Backed by fresh Series A funding, the AI-native fintech is scaling its autonomous finance platform to help enterprises move from retrospective number-crunching to continuous, always-on financial operations.

articles.title: Top Stories | India-US talks in focus, TCS earnings in line, HCLTech beats, CPI inches up and more
articles.summary: Top 10@10 — CNBC-TV18’s daily newsletter featuring the top 10 stories on markets, corporate updates, economic insights, and financial highlights — delivered at 10 pm.

articles.title: Tata Steel secures interim relief extension in ₹1,900 crore and ₹2,410 crore demand matters
HCL Tech Q3: Fresher hiring up sharply; labour code impact at $109 mn; interim dividend declared
articles.summary: HCL Tech Q3: Employee strength largely flat in December quarter; board declares interim dividend of ₹12 per share. HCLTech shares closed at ₹1,667 on NSE ahead of the results, up 0.34%.

articles.title: KPI Green Energy inks ₹4,000-crore pact with Gujarat govt for RE projects
articles.summary: KPI Green Energy signs a ₹4,000-crore pact with the government of Gujarat for renewable energy projects at Vibrant Gujarat Regional Conference; shares closed lower at ₹445.45 on January 12.

articles.title: Sical Logistics bags ₹4,038-crore contract from South Eastern Coalfields
articles.summary: Sical Logistics has secured a ₹4,038 crore contract from South Eastern Coalfields for the Porda Chimtapani open cast project in Raigarh, Chhattisgarh, to be executed over 4,214 days; the contract is a standard domestic deal with no related party involvement.

articles.title: Tata Elxsi shares fall after Q3 results, Motilal Oswal sees downside on valuations
articles.summary: Motilal Oswal said that while execution improved during the quarter, growth continues to be uneven and remains largely dependent on transportation-led ramp-ups, with the media and healthcare segments still lagging amid cautious client spending.

articles.title: Oil prices steady post four-day rally, focus shifts to White House meeting on Iran
articles.summary: West Texas Intermediate was near $61 a barrel, after adding over 9% over the previous four sessions. Meanwhile, Brent ended above $65 on Tuesday.

articles.title: Asian equities post small gains, yen weakens
articles.summary: The Nikkei 225 Stock Average increased 0.9%, with the yen slipping past the 159-per-dollar level to its weakest since July 2024. Equities in Japan have increased and the currency has declined amid reports of a snap election.

articles.title: JPMorgan CFO defies Trump on credit card interest: 'We owe it to shareholders'
articles.summary: Shares of JPMorgan fell over 4% on Tuesday after its quarterly results, which beat expectations overall, but its investment banking business underperformed, leading to the stock fall, which in turn, weighed on the Dow Jones as well.

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank shares fall after adjusting for 1:5 stock split — All you need to know
articles.summary: Those who had shares of Kotak Mahindra Bank in their demat account by the end of Tuesday's trading session will only be eligible for the stock split adjustment of shares.

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO allotment Today: Steps to check status, listing date and other details
articles.summary: Shares of Bharat Coking Coal will list on the bourses on Friday, January 16, and the unlisted market premium is pointing towards a strong listing for the Coal India-subsidiary.

articles.title: From US complacency to global PE contraction: fund managers flag spillover risks for India in 2026
articles.summary: Fund managers see 2026 shaping up as a year of valuation discipline rather than easy gains, with risks emanating from developed markets, a potential dollar rebound and crowded global trades. While near-term volatility and multiple compression could test Indian equities, selective opportunities may emerge as earnings momentum and macro support gradually improve.

articles.title: Indian Overseas Bank cuts overnight MCLR by 5 bps
articles.summary: The one-month MCLR stands at 8.30%, three-month at 8.40%, six-month at 8.65%, and the one-year MCLR at 8.80%. The two-year MCLR is also unchanged at 8.80%, while the three-year MCLR continues at 8.85%.

articles.title: US inflation eases in December as core prices show slowdown
articles.summary: The 2.6% annual rise in core CPI in the US marks the slowest pace of inflation since March 2021. On a headline basis, the all-items CPI rose 0.3% for the month and 2.7% year-on-year, matching both November’s increase and consensus estimates.

articles.title: Raamdeo Agrawal's big call: Auto will be the star sector in 2026

Large caps, in general, were highlighted as better positioned than mid and small caps in the current market phase.

articles.title: Trump changed the rules, China woke up, and Indian IT has a problem: Manish Chokhani

articles.title: Omaxe to invest ₹500 crore in Ludhiana mixed-use project; seeks focus on urban infra, connectivity

articles.title: Trade Setup on January 14: Volatile Nifty heads into another expiry with 25,700 being a key options support

articles.title: Reliance Industries Q3 Preview: O2C seen driving growth; oil & gas under pressure

articles.title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO becomes second-most subscribed PSU issue, just behind Mazagon Dock

articles.title: Amagi IPO: CEO says move to profit is structural, not a listing clean-up

articles.summary: Gurmeet Chadha, Managing Partner and CIO at Complete Circle, said that at current levels the stock is trading at nearly 40 times earnings, which means it is not inexpensive, but it can still appeal to investors with a long-term and patient approach.

articles.title: Land-for-jobs: Lalu had no role in appointments as minister, CBI to HC

articles.title: BMC Elections 2026: Mumbai set to vote for 227 corporators on Jan 15; know your candidates

Over the decades, poor safety systems, illegal extraction, and weak monitoring have led to some of the country’s worst industrial tragedies. Here is a look at eight of the most serious mining disasters in India.

articles.title: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz visits Bosch campus in Bengaluru

The company — the world’s most valuable corporation — dominates the market for artificial intelligence accelerators, the chips that help develop and run AI models. But a small handful of giant tech customers account for much of its revenue.

articles.title: Old vs new tax regime: What suits you best

articles.title: CTC vs take-home: How your salary structure impacts your net pay

As Kuljeet Singh, Chief Financial Officer at GI Group Holding, explains, the way salary components are structured plays a decisive role in determining take-home income. With the new labour codes and tax rules shaping compensation in FY2025–26, understanding salary structure is now critical for both short-term cash flow and long-term financial security.

articles.title: Your salary has hidden tax rules: Which allowances get taxed, are partly spared or fully free?

articles.title: Tired of 'market risk' in retirement? NPS may soon offer assured payouts

articles.title: India’s income tax slabs explained: How much tax will you pay in FY2025-26?

This photo story breaks down the slabs with simple examples to show how tax is actually calculated and why slab awareness matters for take-home pay.
